title: Hello! I am Yao Hao!
text:
A little self-introduction about myself!
I am currently a Applied Computing undergraduate with a specialisation in Fintech at the Singapore Institute of Technology, I have developed a passion for leveraging technology to drive innovation in the financial sector. My journey began during my polytechnic years, and I had the privilege of implementing classroom knowledge into real-world impact during my internship at The FinLab. It was a transformative experience witnessing how technology can enhance efficiency and bring benefits to the industry.
My academic journey equipped me with a diverse skill set such as Python, C, C#, SQL, and RPA, enabling me to navigate the dynamic landscape of fintech. My academic foundation, coupled with practical experience, positions me to contribute meaningfully to the intersection of finance and technology.
During my free time, I spend valuable moments with family and friends through games and outdoor activities like playing basketball, hiking and running. These experiences not only create lasting memories but also strengthen bonds with loved ones, ensuring no regrets.



‘A picture of me recently at Hainan while travelling with my family!’


My LinkedIn Profile https://www.linkedin.com/in/koh-yao-hao/.

title: School Lab research on Titanic
text: RMS Titanic was a British ocean liner that sank on 15 April 1912 after striking an iceberg on the ship’s maiden voyage from Southampton, England to New York City, United States. Of the estimated 2,224 passengers and crew aboard, approximately 1,500 died, making the incident the deadliest sinking of a single ship at the time. Titanic, operated by the White Star Line (Wikipedia), carried some of the wealthiest people in the world, as well as hundreds of emigrants from the British Isles, Scandinavia, and elsewhere in Europe who were seeking a new life in the United States and Canada. The disaster drew public attention, spurred major changes in maritime safety regulations, and inspired a lasting legacy in popular culture. Source: Wikipedia.

title: School Lab research on Titanic
text:
Why is the Titanic Famous?
The Titanic is famous for many reasons, including:

She was the largest ship in the world.
She sank on her maiden voyage.
Her captain received many warnings of ice on the route but did not reduce speed.
There were not enough lifeboats for all the people on board.
Many crew and paying passengers lost their lives, but the man that effectively owned the Titanic somehow survived.
With millionaires as well as people in dire poverty, there was a diverse mix of passengers and crew, leaving behind many fascinating stories of their lives.

Source: Encyclopedia Titanica

title: School Lab research on Titanic
text:
Survival Rate
According to Encyclopedia Titanica, the survival rate of the passengers was as follows:



Class
Survived
Total
Survival Rate




1st Class
201
324
62.04%


2nd Class
118
284
41.55%


3rd Class
181
709
25.53%


Crew
212
891
23.79%





Was Survival Dependent on Class?

“I can never understand why God would have spared a poor Finnish girl when all those rich people drowned.”
— Anna Sofia Turja (3rd-class passenger)

This quote raises the question: Were 1st-class passengers more likely to survive than 3rd-class passengers? The data suggests that they were. The survival rate of 1st-class passengers was 62.04%, while the survival rate of 3rd-class passengers was only 25.53%. Crew members were even less likely to survive than 3rd-class passengers.
For passengers, the more luxurious the class, the more likely they were to survive. This is because the 1st-class cabins were located closer to the lifeboats, making it easier for 1st-class passengers to reach them in time.



Anna Sofia Turja


Photo of Anna Sofia Turja before the Titanic disaster. Image from Encyclopedia Titanica.

title: School Lab research on Titanic
text:
The Titanic Movie (1997)



Titanic Movie Poster


The Titanic movie was released in 1997 and was directed by James Cameron. The movie was a huge success and won 11 Academy Awards. It tells the story of the Titanic disaster and the love story between Jack and Rose, two passengers on the ship.
The movie was praised for its special effects and attention to detail in recreating the ship and the disaster. However, it was also criticized for its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of the events. Despite this, it became the highest-grossing film of all time at its release. The movie was re-released in 3D in 2012 to mark the 100th anniversary of the Titanic disaster.
Video

title: School Lab research on Titanic
text:
Summary

The Titanic was one of the largest ships of its time.
She sank during her maiden voyage.
The more luxurious the class of the passengers, the more likely they were to survive.
Crew members were even less likely to survive than 3rd-class passengers.

title: Travel Blog
text:
Recently I have been to Thailand and China (Hainan). I went to Phuket, Thailand for a short getaway with my friends during school holidays! We had been planning to go on a trip together for a very long time and it is a trip created from a group! After returning from Phuket, it was time for a trip to Hainan, China with my family and relatives! It was a great experience to travel with my family and relatives as we had a lot of fun together!
Here are some pictures of my trip.

title: My reflection on Lab 1 Assessment
text: It is Week 2 of the semester and i am learning R programming for the first time. I have never used R before and it is a new experience for me. I have been learning the basics of R programming and how to use RStudio. I have also been learning how to use R Markdown to create documents that combine R code and text. I have been enjoying the process of learning R programming and I am excited to learn more as I practice. I used Co-Pilot & ChatGPT in helping me with understanding various syntax meaning and how i can apply the markdown at appropriate places. It is very beneficial for me as a beginner in R programming as it provides all the basic coding syntax and example that i need to know. At the same time, i think it can be challenging as I do not know everything about R and can be hard at times to ask ChatGPT about it. Furthermore, ChatGPT might not be able to understand my question and provide me with the correct answer. I will continue to practice and learn R programming as I am excited to see how it can help me with Data Visualisation in future!
